column4: I just installed wicd how do I disable the "default" network manager?
disable/uninstall
you can remove nm-applet from startup applications.  i wouldn't uninstall it.
Isn't there an applet for wicd also?
i thought you said you installed it already...
I have wicd installed, I just haven't put the applet in the panel yet.
i'm not sure.  it showed up in the notification area automatically IIRC
Hmm...ok.
It's not showing in the notification area "by default" for me...unless I need to reboot...
...is it running?
wicd? afaik...
should have an entry in your menu as well ;)
I do have an entry for the wicd network manager
i don't lie ;)
Just ddon't have anything in the notification area
hrm.  notification area is enabled..?  i dunno.
Ummm...need to think outside the box now :P
reboot?
Of COURSE notification area is installed...or I wouldn't know it wasn't showing in it :P
reboot then, i'm not sure.  it worked for me, that's all i remember.
Ok.
